> [kaffie](#comment_994_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Not everyone is running the tor browser. Why would they? The big issues are that it defeats the purpose of having a distributed network, [...]

I agree on both parts, but think they're separate issues. I run on TOR browser but that's because I want anonymity ATOP of decentralization, both P2P on ZeroNet but also in case I get bounced out on the clearnet.

1565530789_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsK.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_1002_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): In practice there needs to be a way to disable these caps.

On RetroShare (somewhat comparable to ZeroNet in decentralization but with a heavy emphasis on filesharing) every user can select two options for seeding forums, blogs, "subreddits" etc;

"Download content from last:" 5, 7, 14 or 30 days, 3, 6 or 12 months or forever.
"Seed content from last:" 5, 7, 14 or 30 days, 3, 6 or 12 months or forever.

Granted the counter on ZN is in kB, why not "Store and seed last:" X kB/mB's, with a slider the user controls?
